column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Is this your first international interview ?
#Text=What newspapers or magazines have been in contact with you ?
#Text=Actually this is the second international interview .
#Text=At the beginning of the blog , Bloomberg Channel from New York interviewed me too .
#Text=In Brazil , I have been interviewed by the main vehicles for communication .

#Text=Only the Rede Globo did n't interview me because of the denouncements that I have made against it : the 2.8 billions reals loan from BNDES [ Brazilian Development Bank ] and its daily manipulation of information .
#Text=Did you expect that your blog would become so famous ?
#Text=I was n't expecting fame .
#Text=Besides , I was expecting anything .

#Text=I have laughed a lot because of all the repercussion caused by the blog , however the main subject , as I see , it was the changes in the behaviours of the main personages of this crisis which were caused by the blog .
#Text=In the media and in the parlamentarians .
#Text=Do you receive a lot of emails ?
#Text=I 've already received many , about 300 emails per day at the peak of the crisis and popularity of the blog .
#Text=In July , I could sleep only 3 hours by night .
#Text=I answered everyone .
#Text=At present time , there are usually 20 emails by day .
#Text=I love that . ( laughs )
#Text=Journalism
#Text=Do you know about citizen journalism in Portuguese ?
#Text=No. This practice is not common in my country .
#Text=The blog Vizinho do Jefferson ( Jefferson 's neighbor ) opened a great discussion about this subject , since journalistic occupation is reserved to the ones who have a diploma of journalism .
#Text=The first unofficial and " outlaw " vehicle [ of communication ] which really worked with citizen journalism was my blog .
#Text=It is called " independent press " here .

column1: #Text=Is there any threat of working as an " independent press " since you do not have a journalist diploma ?

column3:

column1: #Text=Yes , the journalist union can sue me anytime .
#Text=However I am not taking any job .
#Text=You said that your blog caused some repercussions among some people .
#Text=Can you cite some cases ?
#Text=About this subject , I would like to say too that the journalism elite likes my work and finds it of great importance .
#Text=Only minor journalists are criticizing me and trying to disturb my work .
#Text=Have you read the Portuguese-language Wikinews coverage about the scandal ?
#Text=What do you think about it ?
#Text=Unfortunately not .
#Text=Excuse me , but I have to work on my blog 24 hours by day , getting and checking the information ; some other histories are investigative .
#Text=You are invited to follow the Wikinews coverture about the crisis .
#Text=A lot of articles have already been written .
#Text=Do you think that the internet has changed something in the relationship between Brazilian people and the press ?
